intro: Parahellenia mulus, commonly known as the Greek bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Parahellenia mulus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
